numbered_ace_sentences: 2. In all three categories, young women reach out to their parents more than young men.
3. Visiting parents in person is the least popular method of reaching out to parents.
4. Sending texts to parents is the most popular method of reaching out to parents.
5. The difference between young men and young women is smallest in the category of visiting in person.
6. I wonder how far the survey participants live from their parents.
7. I wonder whether jobs affect the methods that participants use to reach out to their parents.
8. I wonder whether college affects the methods that participants use to reach out to their parents.
10. In my community, I know many people around my age.
11. Many of these people plan to go to college.
12. Some people plan to go to a college near their home.
13. Some people plan to go to a college in another state.
14. In the future, we may fit into one of these categories.
15. This depends on the path in life that we take.
16. The headline is: Staying Connected: How Today's Youth Keep Their Parents Involved.
